text.3: We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Scientific Programmer.
text.4: The Fenyo lab seeks a software programmer and engineer who will implement new algorithms for analyzing and integrating large multi-omic data sets from studies of cancer, metabolic disease, pain, aging, environmental influences, and forensics. Teaching programming to biomedical researchers, and writing related technical reports and publications, are also important parts of the responsibilities.

li: Develop and modify moderately complex software and demonstrations
li.1: Document for all software, code and experiments
li.2: Ensure the integrity and security of data and code
li.3: Setup and run computational experiments to execute algorithms on various types of biomedical data

text.5: To qualify you must have a

li: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Math/Statistics/Physics/Bioinformatics or related technical discipline.

text: Ability to work independently (e.g., find papers relevant to the subject, assess methods, implement methods, and apply them to datasets to reproduce results).

text.6: Basic understanding of key machine learning and statistical methods

text: Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.
